intro: Phacelia dubia var. rionensis, commonly known as the Rionese phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, lance-shaped leaves are arranged oppositely along the stem. It is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, contributing to local biodiversity.
